com.pb.sawdust.util

Class ClassInspector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.ClassInspector

  • public class ClassInspector
extends java.lang.Object
    The ClassInspector class provides static methods for analyzing Class objects. It is intended to augment the methods contained in Class.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getLowestCommonClass

        public static <T> java.lang.Class<? extends T> getLowestCommonClass(java.lang.Class<? extends T> class1,
                                                    java.lang.Class<? extends T> class2)
        Get the "lowest" class shared by two classes in their class heirarchies. For example, if one class's heirarchy is Object-A-B, and anothers is Object-A-C, then A would be their lowest common class. Since all objects descend from Object, the lowest common class for two completely unrelated classes would be Object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type (or, possibly supertype) of the lowest common class.
        Parameters:
        class1 - The first class.
        class2 - The second class.
        Returns:
        the lowest common class in the inheritence trees for class1 and class2.

      • getLowestCommonClass

        public static <T> java.lang.Class<? extends T> getLowestCommonClass(java.lang.Class<? extends T>... classes)
        Get the "lowest" class shared by a series of classes in their class heirarchies. For example, if one class's heirarchy is Object-A-B, and anothers is Object-A-C, then A would be their lowest common class. Since all objects descend from Object, the lowest common class for two completely unrelated classes would be Object. If only one class is passed in, then that class is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type (or, possibly supertype) of the lowest common class.
        Parameters:
        classes - The classes.
        Returns:
        the lowest common class in the inheritence trees classes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if classes is empty.

      • getLowestCommonClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getLowestCommonClass(java.lang.Object... objects)
        Get the "lowest" class shared by a series of objects in their class heirarchies. For example, if one object's class heirarchy is Object-A-B, and anothers is Object-A-C, then A would be their lowest common class. Since all objects descend from Object, the lowest common class for two completely unrelated classes would be Object. If only one object is passed in, then that object's is returned.
        Parameters:
        objects - The objects in question.
        Returns:
        the lowest common class for objects.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if objects is empty.

      • getLowestCommonComponentClass

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T,S extends T> java.lang.Class<? extends T> getLowestCommonComponentClass(S[]... arrays)
        Get the "lowest" component class shared by a series of arrays in their copmonent class heirarchies. This is essentially a convenience method for calling getLowestCommonClass(Class[]) on the component classes of the input arrays.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the lowest common class.
        S - The type(s) of the input arrays.
        Parameters:
        arrays - The arrays in question.
        Returns:
        the lowest common component class for arrays.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if arrays is empty.

      • getInterfaceIntersection

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>> getInterfaceIntersection(java.lang.Class<?> class1,
                                                         java.lang.Class<?> class2)
        Get the set of shared interfaces between two classes. If no interfaces are shared by the two classes, an empty set is returned.
        Parameters:
        class1 - The first class.
        class2 - The second class.
        Returns:
        the set of interfaces implemented by class1 and class2.
